column1:
## Reason for admission
46-year old male who came in on the 2024-02-19 following a referral from primary care doctor where he seeked medical attention for abdominal pain in past 5 days, constpation for 4 days and vomiting.

## Medical history
Appendectomy as a child. Hypothyroidism. Admitted to the gastroenterological ward earlier in January due to abdominal pain. Biopsy showed chronic ileitis in January.

## Hospital course
Patient reported sever abdominal pain. VAS 4-7. LPK 8,9. CRP 49. No fever. Liverenzymes and amylas within reference. Examination revealed pain when palpated in the lower abdomen, more prominently in the right fossa. No other findings in physical examination. ECG with sinus rythm, No signs of ischemia. CT of abdomen indicating ileitis in terminal ileum. Admitted to the gastroenterological unit because of terminal ileitis signs. Not fully recovered since discharge from the hospital in January. Worsening of abdominal pain 6 days ago and troubles eating because of nausea and vomiting. Gastroscopy done to exclude Chrons or celiac disease according to gastroeneterologists recommendations. Shows duodenopathy. Biopsy taken (celiac disease) and Helicobacter test. Initially 0 per os and received 1000 ml Ringer-Acetate and thereafter 1000 ml glucose with sodium and potassium. Stool culture advised but not taken in the ward. Antibodies for transglutaminase taken. Clinical improvement, less abdominal pain and wished to go home. CRP down to 29. 

## Medications
- Alvedon (Paracetamol) 500 mg 2+0+0
- Ringer-Acetate (Ringer-Acetate) 1000 Ml 0+0+0
- Glucose 5% 40 Na 20 K 1000 Ml 0+0+0
- Oxynorm (Oxikodon) 5 mg 1+0+0
- Midazolam (Midazolam) 1 mg 1+0+0
- Alfentanil (Alfentanil) 0.5 mg 0,7+0+0

## Discharge plan
Patient is referred to the gastroenterological outpatient clinic for a follow-up.

## Procedures
 UJD05 Gastroscopy 

## Secondary diagnosis
- Abdominal pain
- Constipation
- Hypothyroidism

## Primary diagnosis
R104X Abdominal pain

## Differential diagnosis
- Chrons disease 
- Celiac disease 
- Gastroenteritis
